name: py-pysam

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description: A python module for reading, manipulating and writing genomic data sets.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-cython
dependencies.description: The Cython compiler for writing C extensions for the Python language.

dependencies.name: curl
dependencies.description:
cURL is an open source command line tool and library for transferring
data with URL syntax

dependencies.name: bcftools
dependencies.description:
BCFtools is a set of utilities that manipulate variant calls in the
Variant Call Format (VCF) and its binary counterpart BCF. All commands
work transparently with both VCFs and BCFs, both uncompressed and BGZF-
compressed.

dependencies.name: htslib
dependencies.description: C library for high-throughput sequencing data formats.

dependencies.name: samtools
dependencies.description:
SAM Tools provide various utilities for manipulating alignments in the
SAM format, including sorting, merging, indexing and generating
alignments in a per-position format

dependent_to.name: py-biomine
dependent_to.description: Bioinformatics data-mining.

dependent_to.name: py-atropos
dependent_to.description:
Atropos is tool for specific, sensitive, and speedy trimming of NGS
reads. It is a fork of the venerable Cutadapt read trimmer.

dependent_to.name: py-crossmap
dependent_to.description:
CrossMap is a program for convenient conversion of genome coordinates
(or annotation files) between different assemblies

dependent_to.name: py-htseq
dependent_to.description:
HTSeq is a Python package that provides infrastructure to process data
from high-throughput sequencing assays.

dependent_to.name: hic-pro
dependent_to.description:
HiC-Pro is a package designed to process Hi-C data, from raw fastq files
(paired-end Illumina data) to the normalized contact maps

dependent_to.name: py-instrain
dependent_to.description:
inStrain is python program for analysis of co-occurring genome
populations from metagenomes that allows highly accurate genome
comparisons, analysis of coverage, microdiversity, and linkage, and
sensitive SNP detection with gene localization and synonymous non-
synonymous identification.

dependent_to.name: py-cmseq
dependent_to.description:
CMSeq is a set of commands to provide an interface to .bam files for
coverage and sequence consensus.

dependent_to.name: py-wub
dependent_to.description:
Bioinformatics tools and a software library developed by the Oxford
Nanopore Technologies Applications group.

dependent_to.name: py-cnvkit
dependent_to.description: Copy number variation toolkit for high-throughput sequencing.

dependent_to.name: py-deeptools
dependent_to.description:
deepTools addresses the challenge of handling the large amounts of data
that are now routinely generated from DNA sequencing centers.

dependent_to.name: py-whatshap
dependent_to.description:
WhatsHap is a software for phasing genomic variants using DNA sequencing
reads, also called read-based phasing or haplotype assembly.

dependent_to.name: py-gemini
dependent_to.description:
GEMINI (GEnome MINIng) is a flexible framework for exploring genetic
variation in the context of the wealth of genome annotations available
for the human genome.

dependent_to.name: py-rnacocktail
dependent_to.description:
RNACocktail: A comprehensive framework for accurate and efficient RNA-
Seq analysis.

dependent_to.name: vifi
dependent_to.description:
ViFi is a collection of python and perl scripts for identifying viral
integration and fusion mRNA reads from NGS data.

dependent_to.name: find-circ
dependent_to.description:
Find-circ is a collection of python scripts detecting head-to-tail
spliced (back-spliced) sequencing reads, indicative of circular RNA
(circRNA) in RNA-seq data.

dependent_to.name: py-umi-tools
dependent_to.description: Tools for handling Unique Molecular Identifiers in NGS data sets

dependent_to.name: py-tetoolkit
dependent_to.description:
TEToolkit is a software package that utilizes both unambiguously
(uniquely) and ambiguously (multi-) mapped reads to perform differential
enrichment analyses from high throughput sequencing experiments.

dependent_to.name: py-misopy
dependent_to.description:
MISO (Mixture of Isoforms) is a probabilistic framework that quantitates
the expression level of alternatively spliced genes from RNA-Seq data,
and identifies differentially regulated isoforms or exons across
samples.

dependent_to.name: py-metaphlan
dependent_to.description:
MetaPhlAn is a computational tool for profiling the composition of
microbial communities (Bacteria, Archaea and Eukaryotes) from
metagenomic shotgun sequencing data (i.e. not 16S) with species-level.

dependent_to.name: py-rseqc
dependent_to.description:
RSeQC package provides a number of useful modules that can
comprehensively evaluate high throughput sequence data especially RNA-
seq data.

dependent_to.name: py-medaka
dependent_to.description:
medaka is a tool to create consensus sequences and variant calls from
nanopore sequencing data. This task is performed using neural networks
applied a pileup of individual sequencing reads against a draft
assembly. It provides state-of-the-art results outperforming sequence-
graph based methods and signal-based methods, whilst also being faster.

dependent_to.name: py-metasv
dependent_to.description:
An accurate and integrative structural-variant caller for next
generation sequencing

dependent_to.name: py-checkm-genome
dependent_to.description:
Assess the quality of microbial genomes recovered from isolates, single
cells, and metagenomes

dependent_to.name: bsseeker2
dependent_to.description: A versatile aligning pipeline for bisulfite sequencing data.

dependent_to.name: py-breakseq2
dependent_to.description: nucleotide-resolution analysis of structural variants

dependent_to.name: reditools
dependent_to.description:
REDItools: python scripts for RNA editing detection by RNA-Seq data.
REDItools are simple python scripts conceived to facilitate the
investigation of RNA editing at large-scale and devoted to research
groups that would to explore such phenomenon in own data but don't have
sufficient bioinformatics skills. They work on main operating systems
(although unix/linux-based OS are preferred), can handle reads from
whatever platform in the standard BAM format and implement a variety of
filters.

dependent_to.name: py-pybedtools
dependent_to.description: Python wrapper -- and more -- for Aaron Quinlan's BEDTools
